thesis.description: The fact that the Coulomb force is due to the exchange of scalar and longitudinal photons between two charged particles is well known. In 1935 Yukawa (1) introduced the hypothesis that the strong nucleon-nucleon interaction is due to the exchange of a kind of quantum having a mass intermediate between that of an electron and that of a nucleon. The pion which is identified as the Yukawa particle was found by Lattes et al.(2) in 1947. Since then the interaction between pion and nucleon has became one of the most interesting problems in physics. A lot of experimental and theoretical work has been done. Of course the fruitful mode of attack on the problem is to study the scattering process between pion and nucleon. The effective range approximation and dispersion relations are usually used to analyse the scattering data. [...]
thesis.creator: Kao, Chun-Ning.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: A study of the effect of strong absorption in S-wave pion nucleon scattering.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Constancy of the form of living cells is one of their most important psysiological characteristics. This is possible only when intracellular and extracellular osmotic pressure is constant. Equal osmotic pressure between the two sidas of cell membranes is provided by the so-called pump mechaaism(s) of ion movements. [...]

thesis.description: The science of extracorporeal circulation is very new. This past decade has witnessed the introduction and subsequent development of temporary extracorporeal circulation as a routine surgical technique which permits the cardiovascular surgeon to repair otherwise incurable lesions in and around the heart. Since the inception of these techniques a great deal of attention has been focused upon problems relating to blood oxygenation and selection of a particular pump with minimum biological effect on the circulating blood. [...]
thesis.creator: Kakvan, Mohammed.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: An evaluation of veno-venous bypass for extracorporeal gas exchange in puppies.

thesis.description: A review of psychiatric classifications in use throughout the world (STENGEL, 1960) reveals that only four out of 38 diagnostic systems provide a classif1ing label for a condition as familiar to clinicians as the schizophrenic residual, or "defect", state.+ The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual ot the A.M.A. (1952) reserves the term Schizophrenic reaction, residual type, for "those patients who, after a definite psychotic, schizophrenic reaction, have improved sutficiently to be able to get along in the community, but who continue to show recognizable residual disturbance of thinking, affectivity, and/or behavior." [...]
thesis.creator: Jilek, Wolfgang G.
thesis.subject: Psychiatry.
thesis.title: The residual dimension: a study of residual syndromes in veterans with chronic psychiatric illness.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: [...] Empirical tests on Canadian and British service respirators have shawn cyanogen chloride to have a short service time on the types of moist charcoals formerly used to fill the canisters. As the testing methods employed gave only an incomplete picture of the factors involved in the sorption process a more detailed study seemed desirable. The problem has been treated in three distinct stages. The first of these consisted of an examination of the preparation and properties of cyanogen chloride with particular attention to the probable traces of impurities that might poison the catalytic impregnants. A rapid method of checking the purity was sought, as well as a knowledge of the physical and chemical behavior. The second stage consisted of measuring the rate of hydrolysis of cyanogen chloride in aqueous solutions since hydrolysis was considered likely to be an important factor in the destruction of the gas on charcoal. The third stage was devoted to sorption measurements under a variety of conditions. In view of these rather distinct subdivisions of the investigation, the data have been presented in the chronological order. Each section is presented separately, and includes the relevant historical and theoretical matter pertaining to the experimental work contained therein. [...]
thesis.creator: Foran, Michael R.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: War resesearch; the sorption of cyanogenchloride on charcoals.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis is concerned with a study or the relationship between the client's 'time' and 'activity' orientations and continuance and discontinuance in counselling after the intake interview at the Family Service Agency in Hamilton, Ontario. It was hypothesized that continuing clients would be 'future-active' or1entated, and discontinuing clients would be 'present-inactive' orientated. The 'time' and 'activity' orientations were struotured into six sub-topics; the client's view of the basie of his difficulty at intake, the service that he requests, his capacity to amass and use relevant faotual information, his capacity to admit the social worker to hia emotions, his confidence in the treatment plan and his trust in the social worker. [...]
thesis.creator: De New, William Paul.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Client life orientations and continuance in casework.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In the pessimistic world of Hans Henny Jahnn it is refreshing to find one subject which the author illuminates with hope. Youth is a theme which Jahnn portrays again and again, sensitively depicting its joys and turmoil even in his later works, when his own youth lay far behind him. The youth Jahnn glorifies is not childhood in general, but rather that time in a child's life when he stands on the threshold to manhood. [...]
thesis.creator: Jackson, Karin Victoria.
thesis.subject: Jahnn, Hans Henny, 1894-1959 -- Criticism.
German.
thesis.title: A study of the main themes in the works of Hans Henny Jahnn, with special emphasis on the novel trilogy Fluss ohne Ufer.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Contemporary trends in civil aviation show a noticeable tendency towards integration of national airline enterprises in many regions of the world. This attitude springs from the economic realities of air transport, the progress of which has been retarded generally by excessive competition and, in certain particular regions, also by such factors as shortages in financial resources and experienced personnel, inadequate equipment, and, at times, inherent difficulties in the operation of air services. [...]

thesis.description: Economic development implies that a country's real output is growing at a faster rate than its population so that over time per caput output rises. One very simple way of achieving the growth of output is to bring formerly unemployed manpower into the labour force. But, since there is an inevitable limit to this method, a far more important aim is to bring about an increase in output per employed worker. [...]

thesis.description: In the decade between Canada's first two decennial censuses, taken in 1851 and 1861, the Province, despite internal political difficulties, had become the largest, wealthiest, most populous, and most economically diversified of all Britain's colonies. The lower St. Lawrence was rugged and inhospitable, but above Quebec the valley widened into a fertile plain on both sides of the river which, in conjunction with the fertile Ontario "peninsula" to the west, supported the bulk of Canada's apopulation. [...]

thesis.description: It is ironic that the organ which was instrumental in the birth of the science of endocrinology (Berthold, 1849) should itself remain the subject of continual controversy as to the precise role hormones play in its functioning. The testis unlike the other endocrine organs, does not lend itself readily to the classical procedure of extirpation, for with ablation of the endocrine function one has of necessity also removed the primary target in the form of the seminiferous tubules. thesis.description: The aim of the present study is to demonstrate the nature of the relation of Russell's political philosophy to the other areas of his work, both popular and professional. The nature of the relation can be demonstrated, however, only if two premises are accepted: (1) that Russell has a political philosophy, and (2) that his political theory is related to the other branches of his philosophy. thesis.description: Erratics and perched boulders in the summit areas indicate total glaciation of the eastern Mealy Mountains.
